transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Good afternoon! This is Carlos from Morgan & Associates. How can I assist you today?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Hi, um, yeah, I was involved in this accident, and I think I might need some help.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I’m sorry to hear that. Can you tell me a bit more about what happened?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Sure, it was, like, on May 26th, I think? I was in Seattle, um, at this grocery store, and I slipped on some... well, it was, like, spilled juice or something.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That sounds really uncomfortable. So, you slipped in the grocery store—did you see if there were any warning signs or if the spill had been there for a while?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Uh, no, there weren't any signs. I mean, I guess it was there for a bit, but, um, I didn't really pay attention. I just, like, lost my balance and fell.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I understand. It’s easy to miss those things in the moment. Were there any employees nearby when you fell? Did anyone come to help you right away?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, um, a couple of employees came over. They helped me get up, but, like, they didn’t really do much else. Just asked if I was okay, you know?

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Got it. So, after the fall, did you seek any medical attention?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, I went to the hospital later that day. My back and, like, my wrist really hurt. They did some X-rays and stuff, but, um, they didn’t find any fractures, just some sprains and strains.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I’m sorry to hear about your injuries. It’s important to keep track of any medical records related to this. Have you had any follow-up appointments since then?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Um, yeah, I went back a couple of times for physical therapy. But it’s, like, been really hard to do everyday stuff now, you know?

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That sounds tough. So, it seems like your injuries have impacted your daily life. Can you tell me if you missed work because of this?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, I had to take, like, two weeks off, but I’m back now. It was a struggle, though, ‘cause I work as a delivery driver, and, um, lifting boxes and stuff was really hard with my wrist.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That must have been frustrating for you. Have you been able to get any documentation from your employer about your missed work?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Uh, yeah, I think I have something from them. I can check.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Great. That’ll help us understand the impact better. Now, regarding the grocery store—do you happen to know if they have insurance? Did you exchange any information with them?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Um, I think they have insurance? I didn’t really talk to them about it, but, like, the employees said they’d file a report. I didn’t get any of their info, though.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Okay, that’s helpful to know. Sometimes, they have their own insurance that will cover these types of incidents. Have you spoken to anyone else about this, like another attorney or anything?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: No, no one else. I just, like, thought I’d call you guys first.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That’s perfectly fine. We’re here to help. Now, just to clarify, have you ever had any previous injuries or medical issues that might relate to your back or wrist?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Um, yeah, I mean, I did hurt my wrist a while ago, but it was, like, years ago. It wasn’t a big deal, you know? I just kind of tweaked it.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Thanks for sharing that. It’s good to have a complete picture. Since this injury is recent, we’ll focus on that. Now, if you don’t mind me asking, have you ever had any legal issues in the past?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Well, um, I did get arrested a few years back, but that’s, like, all behind me now. I just—uh, it was a misunderstanding, really.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I appreciate your honesty. It’s important for us to have all the details. Alright, so just to summarize the key points: You slipped in a grocery store in Seattle on May 26th, you sustained injuries to your back and wrist, you missed work for two weeks, and you haven’t consulted with any other attorney yet. Is that correct?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, that sounds about right.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Perfect. The next step is for me to pass this information along to one of our attorneys. They’ll review your case and reach out to you soon. Just to let you know, we work on a contingency fee basis, which means you don’t pay unless we win your case.

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Okay, that sounds good. Thanks for explaining that.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: No problem at all! If you have any other questions in the meantime, feel free to ask. Otherwise, you can expect a call from us soon.

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Alright, thanks, Carlos. I appreciate your help.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: You’re welcome! Take care, and we’ll be in touch soon.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Hi there! Thanks for calling Morgan & Associates. My name is Carlos. How can I help you today?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Uh, hi. I, um, I need to talk about an accident I had, uh, last Christmas.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Of course! I'm sorry to hear you were in an accident. Could you tell me a bit more about what happened?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, so, um, I was at home, and I was trying to, like, use this new blender I got as a gift. It, um, exploded or something? Like, it just, it didn't work right and, you know, there was stuff everywhere.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That sounds really frustrating! I'm glad you’re okay. So, just to clarify, you were using a blender, and it malfunctioned. Did you suffer any injuries from that incident?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Oh, yeah, for sure. I got, um, some cuts on my hands from the glass and, uh, I think I might have, like, sprained my wrist trying to catch it before it fell. It was, um, really messy.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I'm sorry to hear that. It sounds painful! How severe were those injuries? Did you need to seek medical attention?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, I went to the ER because, um, my wrist was hurting a lot. They, like, gave me a splint and some pain meds. I was in a lot of pain for a few weeks, you know?

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That sounds really tough. So, it sounds like you had significant injuries. Did you happen to keep any records of your medical visits or treatments?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Um, I think I have the, like, the hospital discharge papers somewhere. I didn’t really think about it until now, but, uh, I guess it's important, right?

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Yes, having those records will definitely help. Now, about the blender—do you know the brand or where it was purchased?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Uh, I think it was, um, some brand called, like, Blendy or Blendex? I’m not, um, totally sure. I just remember it was from one of those online stores.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Got it. And did you, um, report this incident to the manufacturer or the seller at all?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Uh, no, not really. I just, like, cleaned it up and tried to forget about it. I didn't think, um, it would matter much.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That’s understandable. It can be overwhelming after an incident like that. Now, did you get any insurance information related to the blender? Like, do you know if it’s covered by any warranty or anything?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Um, I think it had a warranty? But I didn’t check what it was. I just, like, saved the box and stuff. I’m not sure if that helps.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: It might! It's definitely worth looking into. Now, just to confirm, you mentioned you were injured, and you went to the ER. Have you had any follow-up visits or ongoing treatments since then?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Um, yeah, I went back a couple of times for the wrist, but, like, not much else. They said it would heal but, um, it still kinda hurts, you know?

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I understand. Chronic pain can be really difficult to deal with. Have you had any other expenses related to this injury, like physical therapy or missed work?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Oh, yeah! I, um, missed a couple of weeks at work, and my boss wasn’t, like, super happy about it. I think I lost, um, some money because of that.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I’m really sorry to hear that. It sounds like it’s been quite a burden. Just to clarify, do you have any other representation or lawyers currently working on this case?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Uh, no, I don’t. I was, like, just thinking about it, you know?

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That’s good to know! Now, based on what you’ve shared, it seems like you have significant injuries and some potential product liability issues. I’ll pass this information to one of our attorneys who will review it and get back to you. They will follow up with you to discuss the next steps.

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Okay, that sounds good. Um, what happens now?

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: After I gather all this information, our attorney will review your case more closely and, um, they might reach out to you for additional details or to discuss potential legal options. Just so you know, we work on a contingency fee basis, so you won’t owe any fees unless we win your case.

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Oh, that’s good to know. I was, like, worried about costs.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I totally understand. It’s a common concern. Just to wrap up, can you confirm your name and the best way to reach you?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, it’s, um, Jamie Carter, and you can reach me at my cell, it's, uh, 555-123-4567.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Great! Thank you, Jamie. I’ll make sure our attorney gets this information. Is there anything else you want to ask or discuss today?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Um, I think that's it. Thanks for your help!

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: You’re welcome! I appreciate you sharing your story with me. We’ll be in touch soon. Take care!

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Hi there! Thank you for calling Morgan & Associates. My name is Alex. How can I help you today?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Um, hi—yeah, I, uh, I was in a car accident a little while ago, and I’m just trying to figure out what to do next.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I’m really sorry to hear that you were in an accident. I’d be happy to help gather some information. Can you tell me when the accident happened?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, it was on June 21st, uh, 2023.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Got it. And where did the accident occur?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: In Boston, Massachusetts.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Thanks for that. Can you walk me through what happened in the accident?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Sure, um, I was driving, and I had a green light, and then this other car just, like, ran the red light and crashed into me.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That sounds really scary. I’m glad you’re okay. Were there any witnesses to the accident?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, there were a couple of people around who saw it, um, they even came over to check on me.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That’s good to hear. Witnesses can really help in these situations. Did you exchange insurance information with the other driver?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Um, yeah, I got their insurance info, but I don’t remember the company name, um. I think it was, uh, something like… State something?

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That’s alright! We can figure that out later. Did you need to file a police report?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, the police came and, um, they took a report. I think it was filed under my name.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Perfect. That documentation can be really helpful. Now, can you tell me about any injuries you sustained from the accident?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Oh, yeah. I, um, I had, like, significant injuries. I hit my neck and back pretty hard. I’ve been dealing with, uh, pain since then.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I'm sorry to hear that you're in pain. Have you sought medical treatment for those injuries?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Uhh, not right away. I didn’t go to the hospital immediately. I thought it was just a sprain, but then, like, a week later, I couldn’t move my neck. So, I went to a doctor.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: It sounds like you had to delay treatment, which can be tough. What did the doctor say about your injuries?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: They, um, said I have some muscle strain and maybe some nerve issues. I also have, like, pre-existing back problems, so they’re not sure how much is from the accident.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That makes sense. It’s common for pre-existing conditions to complicate things. Have you had any physical therapy or additional treatments since then?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, I started physical therapy a few weeks ago, and it’s been, um, really helpful, but it’s still painful.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I can understand how frustrating that must be. Have you missed any work because of your injuries?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Uh, yeah. I’ve missed, like, three weeks so far. I work as a, um, graphic designer, so it’s been hard to, like, sit at my desk for long.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That sounds really challenging. Have you been able to keep track of any medical bills or costs related to your treatment?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: I have some bills. They’re piling up, um, over a thousand dollars, I think. I’m not sure how much exactly.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Every bit of documentation will help us understand your situation better. Have you already spoken to any other attorneys about this accident?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: No, I haven’t. You’re the first people I’m talking to about it.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Great, thank you for trusting us with your case. Just to clarify, are you aware of whether the other driver has insurance coverage for this type of incident?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: I think they said they had insurance, but, um, I don’t know the details.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That’s okay. We can look into that further if we proceed. Now, I want to recap what we’ve discussed so far. You were in a car accident on June 21st in Boston, where another driver ran a red light and crashed into you. You sustained significant injuries, particularly to your neck and back, and you delayed medical treatment initially. You've started physical therapy and missed work, leading to some medical bills. You haven’t spoken to any other attorneys yet, and you exchanged insurance information with the other driver, but you're not sure about the specifics.

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, that sounds right.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Alright! The next step will be for me to pass this information along to one of our attorneys. They'll review everything and get back to you. Do you have any questions for me before we wrap up?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Umm, just one—how do the fees work?

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Great question! We work on a contingency fee basis, which means you won’t owe us anything unless we win your case. If we do, our fees will come from the settlement or judgment amount.

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Okay, that makes sense.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I’m glad to hear that! Thank you for sharing your story with me. I’ll make sure to get this information to our attorney, and someone will reach out to you soon. If you think of anything else in the meantime, feel free to call us back.

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Thanks, Alex. I appreciate your help.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: You’re welcome! Take care, and we’ll talk soon.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Hi there! Thanks for calling Morgan & Associates. My name is Diana. How can I assist you today?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Uh, hi. I, um, I need some help with, like, a product issue, you know?

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Of course! I’m here to help. Can you tell me a little more about what happened?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, so, um, I bought this blender, right? It was like, one of those fancy ones, and, um, it, like, exploded while I was using it.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Oh wow, that sounds really dangerous! When did this happen?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: It was, uh, on April 24, 2022.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Got it, April 24, 2022. And where did this incident take place?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: In my apartment in, um, Miami, Florida.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Thank you for that. So, you said the blender exploded? Can you describe what exactly happened? Were you injured?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, um, I was, like, pouring a smoothie into a glass, and then, like, it just... boom! It, like, exploded everywhere. I got cut by the glass, and, um, it was, like, really messy.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Oh no! I'm so sorry to hear that. How severe were your injuries? Did you need medical attention?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, I had to go to the ER because, um, I had some cuts on my arm and, like, a bunch of glass in my hand. They had to, like, stitch me up.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That sounds really painful. I hope you’re feeling better now. Did you happen to keep any records, like hospital bills or medical reports from that visit?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Um, yeah, I think I have the bills. They were, like, super expensive. I didn't expect it to be that much!

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: It can definitely add up quickly. Now, about the blender—do you know the brand or model? And did you keep the receipt or any packaging?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Uh, yeah, it was a brand called BlendMaster, I think? I, um, I might still have the receipt. I was, like, really upset, so I didn't check all the details.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Understandable! It’s a lot to deal with after an incident like that. Have you had a chance to contact the manufacturer or retailer about what happened?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Uh, no, I didn’t. I was, like, too busy dealing with my injuries and everything.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That makes total sense. Have you discussed this with any other attorneys or received any legal advice about your case?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: No, I haven’t talked to anyone else. I just, um, didn’t know what to do.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: You're in the right place to get some guidance. Now, about the blender, did you notice if there were any warnings or instructions that might have been missing? Or anything that seemed off before it exploded?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Um, I mean, it had a manual, but, like, I didn’t see anything unusual. I just thought it was, um, supposed to be safe, you know?

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Of course, it’s reasonable to expect that a product like that would be safe to use. Did you happen to take any pictures of the blender after it exploded or of your injuries?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, I took a few pictures, like, right after it happened. They’re on my phone, I think.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That’s great to hear! Having evidence like that can really help. Now, regarding insurance, did you exchange any information with the retailer or manufacturer about their insurance coverage?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Um, no, I didn’t do that either. I just, like, didn’t think about it at the time.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That’s alright; it’s a lot to juggle when you’re in pain and dealing with an incident like this. I’m just trying to gather some details. Have you had any ongoing issues or complications from your injuries since the incident?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Um, yeah, my hand still hurts sometimes, and, like, I can’t grip things as well as I used to.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I’m really sorry to hear that. It’s tough when injuries linger. Have you followed up with a doctor regarding those ongoing issues?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: No, I haven’t gone back yet. I, um, didn’t think it was that serious.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: It’s important to keep an eye on those things, especially if you’re experiencing pain. So, just to summarize what we’ve discussed: You had an incident with a BlendMaster blender on April 24, 2022, in Miami, where it exploded while you were using it, causing cuts that required ER treatment. You have medical bills and photos of the incident, but you haven’t contacted the manufacturer or any attorneys yet. Is that about right?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, that’s correct.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Perfect. The next step is to pass this information along to one of our attorneys who can review it. They’ll get back to you to discuss your options further. Just to clarify, we work on a contingency fee basis, which means you won’t owe us anything unless we help you recover compensation.

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Oh, okay, that sounds good.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Great! If you have any other questions while you wait, feel free to reach out. I’ll make sure to get your info to our team right away. Thank you for calling, and I hope you feel better soon!

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Thanks, Diana! I appreciate your help.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: You’re welcome! Take care!

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Hi there! Thank you for calling Morgan & Associates. This is Diana. How can I assist you today?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Hi, um, I’m calling about a dog bite incident that happened recently.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I'm really sorry to hear that. Can you tell me a bit more about what happened?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Sure! It was on September 1st in Denver. I was just walking in the park, you know, enjoying the day, and then this dog just ran up to me.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That sounds really unsettling. Was the dog on a leash?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: No, it wasn’t. It just came running at me out of nowhere. I think it was a pit bull, but I’m not totally sure.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I can imagine that was quite alarming. Did the dog bite you, or were you able to avoid it?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: No, it bit me on my leg. I tried to back away, but it was too fast.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Ouch! That sounds painful. Did you need any medical treatment for your injury?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, I went to the ER afterward. They had to clean the wound and give me a tetanus shot. I have some bandages on it now.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I’m glad you got the medical care you needed. How would you describe your injuries? Are you experiencing a lot of pain or any complications?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Well, it hurts, but it’s not, like, super bad. Just really sore, and I can’t walk as well as I used to. I’m worried it might get infected, though.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That’s definitely understandable. Infections can be a concern with dog bites. Do you know if the dog was up to date on its vaccinations?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: I don’t know. The owner wasn’t around when it happened. I just saw the dog running around with no one in sight.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That's concerning. Did you happen to get any information about the dog or its owner? Like, did you see anyone who might have been with the dog?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Um, I asked some people in the park, but no one really knew anything. I think the dog was just roaming free.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I see. That makes it a bit tricky, but not impossible. Did you manage to get any insurance information from the owner or see if they had a collar with tags?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: No, I didn’t see any tags, and I didn’t get any insurance info. I was just kind of shocked at the moment, you know?

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Absolutely, I can imagine that would be quite a shock. It's common to feel overwhelmed in situations like that. Have you had a chance to speak with anyone else about your situation, like another attorney?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: No, you’re the first ones I’ve called.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Okay, that’s good to know. Just so you’re aware, we work on a contingency fee basis, which means we only get paid if you win your case. Now, can you tell me if there were any witnesses to the incident?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: There were a couple of other dog owners nearby, but I didn’t catch their names or anything. I was just focused on my injury.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That’s understandable. Witnesses can really help to support your case, though, so if you remember any details later, it might be helpful. Now, how have your daily activities been affected since the bite?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Well, I’ve had to take time off work because I can’t walk properly. It’s really frustrating. I’m in sales, and I need to be out meeting clients.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I can see how that would impact not just your work life but your overall routine, too. Are you experiencing any other damages, like lost wages or extra medical expenses from this?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, I’ve missed a few days already, and the ER visit wasn’t cheap either. I’m worried about how long it’s going to take to heal.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That’s really tough. It sounds like you're dealing with quite a bit. I’ll make a note of the lost wages and medical expenses. Is there anything else you’d like to share about your experience or any other questions you might have?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Um, I guess I just want to know what the next steps are. Like, what happens now?

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Absolutely! What we’ll do is I’ll gather all the information you’ve provided today, and then I’ll pass it along to one of our attorneys. They’ll review your case and get back to you with the next steps. It usually takes a couple of days to hear back.

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: That sounds good. Thanks for your help!

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: You’re welcome! Just to summarize, you were bitten by a dog in a Denver park on September 1st, you received medical treatment, and you’ve experienced pain and lost work due to the incident. You didn’t get any insurance information or witness details, but we’ll see how we can assist you with that. Is that all correct?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yes, that’s right.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Great! Thank you for sharing that with me. We’ll be in touch soon. Take care, and I hope you feel better!

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Thanks, I appreciate it! Bye.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Bye!

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist

transcript.text: Alright, that’s good to know. So, just to recap: You had an incident with a Bella blender in January 2021 in Phoenix, where it exploded while you were using it. transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I can only imagine. Medical bills can add up quickly. Have you discussed any of this with another attorney, or are you currently working with someone?

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist

transcript.text: I understand. It’s tough when you don’t have all the evidence. But it sounds like there were witnesses or police involved, which can help. transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That’s great! Keeping everything organized will make this process smoother. transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist

transcript.text: Um, hi, Carlos. I, uh, I need to talk about a dog bite incident I had, um, a while back.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Of course, I’m sorry to hear that you had to go through that. Can you tell me when the incident happened?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, it was, uh, May 13th, 2023.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Got it. And where did this happen?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: It was, um, in Colorado. I was, like, at a park or something.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Thanks for that detail. Can you describe what happened during the incident?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Sure, so I was just, you know, walking in the park, and, um, this dog just ran at me outta nowhere. It, like, bit my leg.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Oh no, that sounds really scary! Was the dog on a leash at the time?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: No, it wasn’t. Um, the owner was, like, a few feet away, and they didn’t even see it happen at first.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I see. So, was the owner present when the dog bit you?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, they were there, but, um, they seemed kinda distracted, like, talking to someone else.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That must have been frustrating. Did you manage to get the owner's contact information or any insurance details?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, I, um, got their name and number, but I think the dog’s owner said something about their renter’s insurance or whatever.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Okay, that’s helpful to know. Do you remember the insurance company’s name?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Um, it was something like, uh, State Farm? No, wait, it was, uh, Allstate, I think.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Thanks for clarifying that. Now, can you tell me about your injuries? How have you been feeling since the incident?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Oh man, it’s been rough. I had, like, some serious puncture wounds on my leg, and I had to get stitches. Then, um, I had to go to physical therapy too.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I’m really sorry to hear that. How long have you been in therapy?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Ugh, it’s been, like, three months now. I still feel pain sometimes, especially after I walk for a while.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That sounds really tough. Have you been able to work during this time?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Uh, kinda? I’ve missed a lotta days, like, my boss has been understanding, but, um, it’s been hard to keep up with everything.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I can imagine. It’s important to take care of yourself. Have you already spoken to another attorney about this case?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, I talked to someone, but, um, I don't think they're really helping me much.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I understand. It’s important to find someone who fits your needs. Can you tell me why you feel that way about your current attorney?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Well, they’re just, like, really hard to reach. I don’t know, um, it just feels like they’re not invested in my case.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That’s frustrating for sure. We want to make sure you get the attention your case deserves. Just to confirm, have you received any medical bills or documentation related to your treatment?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Oh, yeah, I have a stack of bills from the hospital and the therapy sessions.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That’s good to have. And are there any other damages you think might be relevant, like lost wages or anything else?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, um, I’ve lost some work hours and, ugh, it’s adding up.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I appreciate you sharing that. It sounds like you've been through a lot. Just a couple more questions: did your injuries lead to any criminal activity on your part, or were you involved in any way?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Uh, yeah, I, um, I had a bit of a rough patch before this incident, and I got arrested for something unrelated a few months prior.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I see, thank you for being honest about that. It’s important to be upfront about all aspects of your situation. Now, just to summarize, you were bitten by a dog in Colorado on May 13th, the owner was present but distracted, and you’ve sustained significant injuries that have impacted your work and resulted in medical bills. You also mentioned that you’ve had some trouble communicating with your current attorney.

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, that sounds right.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Great. I’ll pass this information along to one of our attorneys who will review it and get back to you. Just to clarify, we work on a contingency fee basis, so you won’t have to pay anything upfront. Does that sound okay to you?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, that works for me.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Perfect! Thank you for sharing all this information with me today. If you have any questions in the meantime, don’t hesitate to reach out. We’ll be in touch soon, and I hope you feel better soon!

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Thanks, Carlos, I appreciate it.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: You’re welcome! Take care.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Hi there! Thank you for calling Morgan & Associates. My name is Alex. How can I assist you today?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Uh, hi. I’m calling about an accident that happened, um, last year.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Of course! I’m here to help. Can you tell me a bit more about what happened?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, so, um, it was on September 24, 2022. I was at a friend's birthday party in Chicago, and, uh, I ended up falling down some stairs.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I’m really sorry to hear that. Falling down stairs can be really serious. Can you describe how the fall happened?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Sure. So, um, there were some people in front of me, and I was trying to go down to get some drinks, but the stairs were, like, super slippery. There was, um, some spilled soda or something on the steps. I didn’t see it until it was too late.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That sounds really dangerous. Did anyone else witness the fall or mention anything about the slippery stairs?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, there were a few people there. They said it was, like, a hazard and that it should’ve been cleaned up.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That’s important to know. Was there any signage or warnings about the slippery stairs?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: No, not that I saw. I think if they had, I wouldn't have gone down there, you know?

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Absolutely, that makes sense. It sounds like there may have been some clear liability on their part. Can you tell me about any injuries you sustained from the fall?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Oh, um, it was pretty bad. I ended up breaking my wrist and I had some really bad bruising on my side. I also, like, hit my head a little bit.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That sounds really painful. I hope you’re feeling a bit better now. Did you receive any medical treatment for your injuries?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: I did, but it took me a while to go to the doctor. I didn’t want to, um, ruin the party, so I just waited a couple of days before I saw someone.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I understand that. Sometimes we don’t want to make a fuss, but it’s good you eventually sought help. Were you prescribed any medications or therapies after the visit?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, they gave me some pain medication and told me to do physical therapy for my wrist.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Got it. And, um, how are you feeling about your recovery now?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: It’s still not great. I mean, my wrist is, like, pretty stiff, and I can’t do some of the things I used to do.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I’m really sorry to hear that. It must be frustrating to deal with ongoing pain and limitations. Now, regarding the party where the accident happened, do you know if the venue or the homeowner had insurance?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: I think they do, but I’m not sure what company it is. Um, I didn’t get that information at the time.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That’s okay! It’s common not to think about those details in the moment. Do you remember if anyone exchanged insurance information after the accident?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: No, I don’t think so. Everyone was just, like, checking on me and stuff.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Understood. Just to clarify, do you currently have another attorney representing you for this incident?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: No, I don’t. This is the first time I’m, like, reaching out about it.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Thank you for sharing that. I think you’ve provided some really helpful details. To summarize, you had a fall at a friend’s birthday party in Chicago on September 24, 2022, due to slippery stairs, which resulted in a broken wrist and bruising. You received medical treatment, including pain medication and physical therapy, but you're still experiencing some limitations.

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, that’s right.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Great! I’ll pass this information along to one of our attorneys who will review it and get back to you. They’ll be able to discuss your options and next steps.

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Okay, that sounds good.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Before we wrap up, do you have any questions about the process or anything else you’d like to know?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Um, I guess just how it works? Like, do I have to pay anything upfront?

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Good question! We work on a contingency fee basis, which means you don’t pay anything unless we win your case. If we do win, our fees will come from the settlement or award.

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Oh, okay. That makes sense.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I’m glad to hear that! If you think of any other questions later, feel free to reach out. Thank you for sharing your story with me today, and I hope you feel better soon.

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Thanks, Alex. I appreciate your help!

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: You’re very welcome! Have a great day!

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Hi there! Thank you for calling Morgan & Associates. My name is Alex. How can I help you today?

transcript.text: Hi, uh, my name is Jamie. I, um, I wanted to talk about an accident I had a little while ago.

transcript.text: That’s really unfortunate, Jamie. It sounds like the store might have had a responsibility to keep the area safe. Were there any employees around when that happened? Did you report it to anyone?

transcript.text: That makes sense. It’s tough to think clearly in those situations. Did you happen to take any pictures of the area where you fell, or did anyone witness the incident?

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Got it. That could be helpful later on. Now, after the fall, did you seek medical attention?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yes, I went to the hospital that same day. They, um, checked me out and said I had some, like, soft tissue injuries and a concussion. It was really scary.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That does sound scary, Jamie. I can imagine that must have been a lot to deal with. Have you had ongoing treatment for your injuries since then?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, I had physical therapy for a few months, and I still have headaches occasionally. It’s, um, frustrating.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I’m sorry to hear that you’re still dealing with those headaches. It sounds like the injuries have had a significant impact on your life. Have you, um, had any discussions with the grocery store about the incident or reached out to their insurance?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: I haven’t, um, really talked to them. I just, like, got the medical bills and everything, but I didn't know what to do next.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That’s understandable. It's a lot to handle on top of everything else. Did you happen to get any insurance information from the store, like the name of their insurance company?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Um, I think they mentioned something about it. I, uh, have it written down somewhere, but I can’t remember the name right now.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: No problem at all! That’s something we can figure out later. And just to clarify, are you currently working with any other attorneys on this case?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: No, I haven’t talked to anyone else yet.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Okay, great. That gives us a clean slate to work with. So, just to summarize what we’ve discussed: You slipped and fell in a grocery store in Austin on August 4th, 2020, due to a liquid on the floor without any warnings. You sought medical attention and have experienced injuries, including soft tissue damage and concussions, resulting in ongoing headaches. You’ve not yet contacted any attorneys or the store’s insurance.

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, that’s right.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Perfect. The next step is that I’ll pass this information along to one of our attorneys who will review your case. They’ll reach out to you to discuss it further and provide guidance on what to do next. It sounds like you have a solid premise for a claim here, especially given the injuries you’ve mentioned.

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Okay, um, that sounds good.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Great! Before we wrap up, do you have any questions about the process or our fees?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: I’m not really sure how that works.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Sure! We work on a contingency fee basis, which means we only get paid if you win your case. So, there’s no upfront cost for you. We’ll handle all the legal fees, and you won’t owe us anything unless we’re able to secure compensation for you.

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Oh, that’s a relief!

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I’m glad to hear that! It’s important to us that you feel comfortable moving forward. Do you have any other questions or concerns?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: No, I think I’m good.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Alright, Jamie. Thank you for sharing your story with me. I’ll make sure all the details are passed along, and someone from our team will get back to you soon. Take care of yourself, and I hope you feel better!

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Thanks, Alex. I appreciate it!

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: You’re welcome! Have a great day!

transcript.text: Absolutely, that’s understandable. Just to clarify, you’re not currently working with another attorney, right?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: No, I’m not. This is all new to me.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Great, that helps. So, just to summarize everything we’ve discussed: You slipped and fell at a restaurant in Miami on November 17th, injuring your wrist and hip. You want to seek compensation for your medical bills and lost wages, and you haven’t worked with another attorney before.

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yes, that sounds right!

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Perfect! I’ll pass this information along to one of our attorneys, and they will review it and get back to you shortly. Do you have any questions or concerns before we wrap up?

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: You’re very welcome! Thank you for reaching out to us, and I hope you feel better soon. Have a great day!

transcript.text: Hi there! Thank you for calling Morgan & Associates. My name is Carlos. How can I help you today?

transcript.text: Hi, um, I wanted to talk about, like, a dog bite incident that happened a while ago.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I'm really sorry to hear that you went through that. Can you tell me a bit more about what happened?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, so, um, it was on July 10th, 2020, in Austin. I was, like, walking home from my friend’s house and this dog just, um, came out of nowhere, you know?

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That sounds really scary. Do you remember what kind of dog it was?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Uhh, it was, like, a big dog, I think a pit bull or something.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Got it. And you mentioned you were just walking home. Did the dog belong to someone in particular, or was it, like, a stray?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: No, it was, like, a neighbor’s dog. I think it got loose or something.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Okay, so it was a neighbor’s dog. Did you happen to get the owner's name or any information from them?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Um, I think the owner’s name is, like, John or something. I don’t really remember.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: No problem, that happens! Did you exchange insurance information with him?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, um, he said he had insurance, but I don’t know the company or anything.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That’s okay. It’s good that you got some information. Now, can you tell me what happened when the dog attacked? Were you hurt?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, I got bitten on my leg. It was, like, pretty bad. I had to go to the hospital, and they gave me stitches.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I’m really sorry to hear that. It sounds really painful. How are you feeling now?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Um, it’s better, but I still have a scar. And, like, I get scared when I see dogs now.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That’s understandable; it can be tough dealing with that kind of trauma. Did you have any medical expenses related to the treatment?

transcript.text: Yeah, I think, um, it was a few thousand dollars, but my parents paid for it.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: So, your parents handled the medical bills. That makes sense. Have you discussed this incident with any other attorneys, or are you currently being represented by anyone?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: No, um, we haven’t really talked to anyone else about it.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Okay, that’s helpful to know. Now, just to clarify, was there any property damage, like, to your clothing or anything else?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: No, not really. Just, like, a hole in my pants, but whatever.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Alright, so it was mostly about your injuries. I understand this is a tough situation, but we want to make sure we gather all the facts. Can you tell me how the dog owner reacted during the incident?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Um, he was, like, really freaked out and kept saying sorry. I don’t know if he said anything about, like, taking care of the bills or anything.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That’s understandable. It sounds like he was concerned at least. Did you notice if there were any witnesses around when the incident occurred?

transcript.text: Yeah, um, I think there were a couple of people nearby who saw it happen, but I didn't get their names.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist

transcript.speaker: Caller

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Perfect! Is there anything else you’d like to ask or clarify while we're on the phone?

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Alright, thank you for sharing your information with me. I know this can be a difficult topic to discuss, and I appreciate your openness. A lawyer will reach out to you soon to go over everything in more detail. Take care, and have a good day!

transcript.text: Thanks, you too!

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Hi there! Thank you for calling Morgan & Associates. My name is Carlos. How can I assist you today?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Hey, um, hi. I’m calling about an accident I was in, um, not too long ago.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I’m really sorry to hear that you were in an accident. Can you tell me a little more about what happened?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, so, um, it was on November 16th, I think? I was driving in Denver, and I got hit by this other car. I can’t remember all the details, though.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: No worries, take your time. So, you were driving—was the other car at fault, or was it a bit of both?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Um, I think they were at fault? They kinda ran a red light or something. I mean, it was really quick, and I was like, “Whoa!” But, yeah, I think they were speeding too.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Got it, so they ran a red light and were speeding. That sounds really scary! Were you able to exchange insurance information with the other driver?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Um, yeah, I think so. I got their name and insurance, but I can’t remember the company. I think it was, like, State Farm or something?

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Okay, State Farm. That’s helpful. Do you know if they had any kind of insurance coverage, like a policy number or anything?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: No, I didn’t get the policy number. I was just kinda in shock, you know?

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I totally understand; that’s a common reaction after an accident. Now, can you tell me about your injuries? It’s important for us to know how you’ve been affected.

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Oh, right. So, um, I had a pretty bad whiplash and then, like, my back really hurts. I also, um, had a concussion, I think? I went to the hospital, but I didn’t stay overnight.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That sounds really painful, and I’m glad you got medical attention. Have you been following up with any doctors or physical therapy for your injuries?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Um, not really. I went to the ER right after the accident, but then I didn’t go back for, like, a week or so. I was feeling better, I guess?

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: It’s understandable to feel that way, especially if you’re not in severe pain. But it’s really important to keep getting care if you’re still having issues. Do you have any medical records from your visit?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, I think I got some paperwork from the ER. But, um, I didn’t really know what all of it meant. It was just, like, a bunch of notes.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That’s okay; we can help with that later. Just make sure to keep any documents you have. Now, I’d like to know if you had any lost wages or other damages because of the accident, like car repairs or anything?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Oh man, yeah. My car is, like, pretty banged up. I haven’t had it fixed yet because I didn’t know what to do. And I missed a couple of days of school, too.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: I see. So you missed school—how many days was that, do you think?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Um, I think it was, like, three or four days? But it’s hard to remember, you know?

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Totally understandable. Now, I just want to clarify, have you spoken to or hired another attorney regarding this accident?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: No, I haven’t talked to anyone else. I didn’t even know I could.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: No problem at all! I’ll make sure to pass this information along to one of our attorneys who can help you out. Just a couple more questions—did you have any witnesses to the accident?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Um, yeah, there was this guy in a truck behind me. He said he’d back me up if I needed it.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: That’s good to know! Having a witness can really help your case. And one last thing—how are you feeling about everything? Do you feel comfortable with the next steps?

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Um, I guess? I just want to make sure I get my car fixed and, like, that I’m okay, you know?

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Absolutely, that’s really important. You exchanged information with the other driver, who had State Farm insurance, but you don’t have the policy number. You’ve been to the ER but haven’t followed up much since then. Your car is damaged, and you missed a few days of school. You haven’t spoken to any other attorneys, and you have a witness who can back you up.

transcript.speaker: Caller
transcript.text: Yeah, that sounds about right.

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
transcript.text: Great! I’ll pass this information to one of our attorneys, and they’ll review everything and reach out to you soon. Is there anything else I can help you with today?

transcript.speaker: Intake Specialist
